hotspots.hotspot: The results of four flips are too small a quantity to be significant.
You will see that when we increase the number of flips, or trials, the results are more likely to be statistically significant.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: A. 25 out of 30 students improved their test scores after a good night's sleep.
B. An acne cream tested in 20 high schools showed similar results.
C. A study with 30 participants was repeated six times with similar results.
D. A large experimental group of overweight adults lost an average of three pounds in a month using a weight-loss drug while the control group lost no weight.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

multiple.question: There are four engineers working at APP Corp – two male and two female. Does this fact indicate that Jones's study is statistically significant?

figure.text: Professor Jones studied the pay rates for engineers at APP Corp. He found that male engineers earn more than female engineers and wondered if this was discrimination by APP Corp.

multiple.question: Does this fact indicate that Jones's study is statistically significant?

figure.text:
Professor Jones studied the pay rates for engineers at APP Corp. He found that male engineers earn more than female engineers and wondered if this was discrimination by APP Corp.

Jones repeated the study at five other companies that are larger than APP Corp, and he found the same discrepancy.

Nowitz/Photo Researchers, Inc., (4)Blair Seitz/Photo Researchers, Inc., (5)Manchan/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (bkgd)Glow Images/Getty Images.

content.instruction:
• Test 500 16-year-old males on video game play
  • Will boys who complete level 1 in less than 30 minutes also complete level 2 in less than 30 minutes?

hotspots.hotspot: We repeat our research a number of times with different groups of boys.

We find large differences between boys who complete Level 1 in 30 minutes or less and the boys who don't. The successful boys go on to complete Level 2 in 30 minutes or less, while the other boys take more than an hour to complete Level 2.
We calculate our confidence level in our research at .95.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.
scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

multiple.question: If the sample group is large enough, there is no need to repeat a study again.
Psychologists with a confidence level of .95 believe that their research is accurate.
Results of seemingly minor importance can be statistically significant.
Psychologists consider a study statistically significant if there is no more than one chance in ten that the results are due to chance.
A research study should last for at least a month to be statistically significant.
